name: sugar beet production | sugar beet | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1273/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of sugar beet root and 0.67 kg of sugar beet crown and leaf (both fresh matter; sugar beet crown and leaf is labelled 'biowaste'). The yield of sugar beet root is 77640 kg/ha at a moisture content at storage of 77%, the yield of sugar beet crown and leaf is 51760 kg/ha at a moisture content of 86%.;;Sugar beet crown and leaf are only harvested in 0.5% of the cases. This dataset is parameterized with respect to the fraction of crown and leaf harvested. The default fraction of harvested crown and leaf is 0.5%, exchanges in the dataset represent weighted averages of 99.5% of crown and leaf non-harvested and 0.5% harvested. Changes in this fraction will affect corresponing machine processes and direct field emissions, amount of the by product and CO2 bound from atmosphere in exported products.

This activity starts after the harvest of the previous crop. The inputs of seeds, mineral fertilisers and pesticides are considered. Farm manure as an organic fertiliser is only accounted for in terms of direct field emissions; all pre-processes are included in the animal production systems.

The dataset includes all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, fertilisation, weed control, pest management, harvest and transport from field to farm (1 km). Further, direct field emissions are included. The cultivation of green manure during winter before sowing beets is also included. This activity ends after harvest at the farm gate.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The yield data have been updated to an average of the years 2000, 2005 & 2008. (Schweizerischer Bauernverband: Statistische Erhebungen und Sch채tzungen 체ber Landwirtschaft und Ern채hrung 2009)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Refers to an average production in the Swiss lowlands.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data were compiled from statistics, pilot network, fertilising recommendations, documents from extension services, information provided by retailers and expert knowledge. The production data were verified and adjusted by a group of experts.

exchanges.description: ['Biowaste' represents the harvested crown and leaf of sugar beets.] Crown with leaves that is chopped of the sugar beet at harvest is considered a by-product if harvested. Current practice in Switzerland is to crown and leaf in the field as crop residues in which case it is not considered as a by-product.

exchanges.description: Modelled, see chapter 'Emissions of pesticides to agricultural soil' in '01_crop production_direct field emissions and natural resources_v1.0.pdf' - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/documentation)
Calculated value. See the parameters and their comments to understand the calculation.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'sugar beet' is calculated to be circa 1.34E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate rock, as P2O5, beneficiated, dry', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.68E-03 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of sugar beet is calculated to be circa 4.43E-05 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'benzimidazole-compound', 'cyclic N-compound', 'pesticide, unspecified', 'triazine-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 8.87E-05 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
